title: Putin says Russia will take Donbas by force or Ukraine s troops will withdraw
summary: President Vladimir Putin has warned again that Ukrainian troops must withdraw from Ukraine s eastern Donbas region or Russia will seize it, rejecting any compromise over how to end the war in Ukraine. MORE..

title: Highest rainfall in past 24 hours recorded in Akuressa
summary: The highest rainfall recorded during the past 24 hours has been reported from the Akuressa area along the Nilwala River, according to L.S. Sooriyabandara, Director of Irrigation (Hydrology Disaster Management). MORE..

title: Marrikkar Mohamed Thahir takes oath as SJB National List MP
summary: Naina Thambi Marikkar Mohamed Thahir was sworn in as a Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) National List Member of Parliament before Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne today (05). MORE..

title: President calls for urgent action to restore agriculture, livestock, and irrigation sectors
summary: A meeting was held yesterday (04) at the Presidential Secretariat, presided by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, with the participation of officials from the Ministry of Agriculture and the Ministry of Finance... MORE..

title: Congo, Rwanda leaders affirm commitment to Trump-backed peace deal
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump gathered the leaders of the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda to sign a peace deal in Washington on Thursday even as fighting continued in their war-scarred region. MORE..

title: Third reading vote on 2026 Budget in Parliament today
summary: The third reading vote of the 2026 Appropriation Bill, or the 80th Budget Speech is scheduled to be held today (05) at 6 p.m., the Parliament s Department of Communication announced. MORE..

title: Gangaramaya Temple donates Rs. 30 mln to Rebuilding Sri Lanka  Fund
summary: The Chief Incumbent of the Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple, Ven. Dr. Kirinde Assaji Nayaka Thera, stated that support will be extended to coordinate assistance from overseas Buddhist temples. MORE..

title: Putin questions US punishing India for buying Russian oil
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin challenged heavy US pressure on India not to buy Russian fuel if the US could do so as he began a two-day state visit on Thursday (Dec 4), where he was embraced on arrival by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi. MORE..

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
summary: The Northeast monsoon condition is gradually establishing over the island, the Department of Meteorology said. MORE..

title: Russia s Putin arrives in India for summit talks with PM Modi
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin landed in New Delhi on Thursday, where he was received by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the airport, beginning the Russian leader s first visit to old friend India since the start of the war in Ukraine nearly four years back. MORE..

title: Sri Lanka s death toll from adverse weather climbs to 486
summary: The death toll due to the adverse weather conditions experienced in the country in the past few days has climbed to 486 as of 7.00 p.m. today, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) has confirmed. MORE..

title: IMF extends condolences, assesses support measures following Cyclone impact in Sri Lanka
summary: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has expressed deep condolences to the people of Sri Lanka in the wake of the devastating cyclone and severe flooding that has claimed lives and displaced thousands across the country. MORE..

title: PM Harini vows full support to rebuild lives of disaster-affected citizens
summary: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the Government of Sri Lanka extends gratitude to the Tri-Forces, the Police, public officers, volunteer organisations, the public, and all foreign nations who have dedicated themselves to supporting the affected people. MORE..

title: Body of one of five missing navy personnel found
summary: The body of one of the five Sri Lanka Navy personnel who went missing during a flood mitigation operation in the Chalai area in Mullaitivu District has been recovered, Navy Media Spokesperson Commander Buddhika Sampath confirmed. MORE..

title: Chinese president extends condolences to Sri Lankan president over severe flooding
summary: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday sent a message of condolence to Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake over the severe flooding that hit Sri Lanka. MORE..

title: Pakistan sends 80 tons of humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka
summary: Pakistan has dispatched 80 tons of humanitarian assistance to Sri Lanka through the Pakistan National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA), in coordination with SriLankan Airlines, as part of its continued support following the recent natural disaster caused by Cyclone Ditwah. MORE..

title: Death toll due to adverse weather rises to 481 in Sri Lanka
summary: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reported that 481 deaths have been recorded as at 06.00 p.m. today (04) as a result of the adverse weather conditions experienced across the country in recent days. MORE..

title: Fairly heavy showers likely in several provinces
summary: Several spells of showers have been predicted for the Northern, North-Central, Eastern and Uva provinces and in the Matale district today (04), according to the Department of Meteorology. MORE..

title: Sri Lanka Cricket donates Rs. 300 million to Rebuilding Sri Lanka  Fund
summary: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC), under the direction of President Shammi Silva and the Executive Committee, has decided to donate Rs. 300 million to the government s Rebuilding Sri Lanka Fund. MORE..

title: Magnitude 6.0 earthquake strikes China s Xinjiang region
summary: China reported on Thursday a magnitude 6.0 earthquake in Xinjiang, a region in the country s northwest that shares a border with Kyrgyzstan, the China Earthquake Networks Center (CENC) said. MORE..
